result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel R Osornio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Samuel R Osornio appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Chad A. Hendee appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this is the defendant's motion for sentence adjustment.  Court received that motion.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant wants to proceed without.  
Atty Hendee states that along with the petition was a verification of time served in which the days served would be more now since the petition.  Atty Hendee makes arguments and asks that the sentence remain the same.  Court questions the defendant.  
Defendant states that Stanley has no AODA program and would like to be released to be able to take AODA.

BY THE COURT:  Court denies the defendant's motion for sentence adjustment.
Motion hearing on November 3, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Samuel R Osornio in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Defendant Samuel R Osornio in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF27, 15CF85 & 15CM173 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that all parties have received a copy of the revocation packet.  Atty Hendee states that the underwriter did not include Ct. 1 in 15CF85 as this was a DPA that was revoked on August 18th.  Atty Henney received a copy of the revocation packet and have no changes.  
Atty Hendee states that the defendant has been sentenced now on the Adams County cases.  Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.  
Atty Henney makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  
14CF27: Court orders 3 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 2 years Initial Confinement and 1 year Extended Supervision with conditions; concurrent to Adams County sentence and any other sentence the court orders:
Credit = 241 days
Court Costs = $268.00
Restitution to be paid through Probation or Extended Supervision
Comply with any and all treatment recommended by the Agent
Comliance with all rules and regulations while on Extended Supervision
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program

15CF85:  Ct. 1:  Withhold Sentece; 24 months Probation with conditions; consecutive to the sentence the court is imposing:
Credit = 126 days if revoked
Court Costs = $268.00
DNA Sample + $250 Surcharge
Restitution be paid through Probation or Extended Supervision
Ct. 2:  Court orders 9 months in the Marquette County Jail; concurrent to any other sentence
Court Costs = $268.00

15CM173:  Court orders 9 months in the Marquette County Jail; concurrent to any other sentence
Court Costs = $243.00

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
CASH BOND RETURNED UNSIGNED- DEFENDANT SENTENCED BEFORE CASH BOND COULD BE POSTED
restitution information

Defendant Samuel R Osornio in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Defendant Samuel R Osornio in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF27 & 14CM66:
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1 in 14CF27 & Ct. 1 in 14CM66.  Counts 2 & 3 in 14CF27 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty hendee states that the parties have an argued jail sentence.  Atty Henney agrees.   Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 14CF27 & Ct. 1 in 14CM66.  Counts 2 & 3 in 14CF27 to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.  Atty Hendee states that credit will have to be determined by the parties at a later date.  Atty Hendee is requesting an additional 6 months jail time.
Atty Henney makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1 in 14CF27: Withhold Sentence; 48 months Probation with conditions:
120 days in the Marquette County Jail 
*Defendant is to remain in custody and begin sentence forthwith
Credit to be determined between counsel and submitted to the court within 14 days.
Court Costs = $268.00
DNA Sample + $250 Surcharge
Restitution as stated in the supplement
Comply with any counseling recommended by the Agent
AODA and any follow-up treatment
  Counts 2 & 3 to be dismissed and read-in
**Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Bond to be applied to Restitution

Ct. 1 in 14CM66: Withhold Sentence; 48 months Probation with conditions; concurrent:
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Surcharge = $200.00
from person posting bond
Return date on October 29, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Subject in Custody 09-22-14 per MASO
Return date on October 29, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
9/23/14:  Bond amended to $2,000 cash ($500 already posted).  *Not to leave the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Samuel R Osornio by video, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states he spoke with Atty Henney this afternoon and he didn't plan to appear for today's hearing.  Court questions defendant on his failure to appear.  Defendant makes statement and couldn't get a treatment court meeting until the day after his hearing.  Defendant states he tried twice to get in touch with his attorney.  Atty Hendee requests an additional $1500 cash bond.  Defendant makes statement regarding bond.  
BY THE COURT:  Court will set an additional $1500 cash bond with the same conditions.  Return date scheduled for October 29, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Samuel R Osornio
Current: 307 Driscoll Ln, Oxford, WI 53952 United States  (Effective: 09-23-2014)
Prior: 1312 Oak Park Ave, Berwin, IL 60402
FAILED TO APPEAR ON 9/10/14 FOR COURT

Attorney Timothy C. Henney in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee requests warrant be issued on defendant's failure to appear.  Atty Henney states defendant failed to show up for his meeting with treatment Court and thought he would be here today.  Has not heard from his client and cannot explain his absence. 
BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue but will stay the enforcement until the end of business today.
Plea hearing on September 10, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Samuel R Osornio in court with attorney Margaret Andrea Waterman.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the parties are not ready to proceed.  Atty Hendee states that the defendant has gone through the application for treatment court program and was accepted; however, there was some question by Atty Henney to determine if his client would be able to comply with treatment court and will be meeting with the team.
Atty Hendee asks that this be reset after the meeting with Atty Henney and the treatment court team.
Atty Waterman agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 10, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Plea hearing on July 30, 2014 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Samuel R Osornio in court with attorney Timothy C Henney.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF27 & 14CM66:
Atty Hendee states that the parties have been discussing resolution on the matters.  Defendant has now gone through the assessment for Treatment Court and the recommendation will be presented to the Treatment Court team tomorrow.  Atty Hendee states that based on that, the State asks that this be reset.
Atty Henney agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 30, 2014 at 10:45 am.
Plea hearing on June 25, 2014 at 03:15 pm.
*Not to leave the State of Wisconsin.  *Bond amended from $1000.00 cash to $500.00 cash on 5/22/14.

Defendant Samuel R Osornio in court with attorney Timothy C Henney who appears by phone.  Defendant Samuel R Osornio in custody.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states counsel is close to a resolution but they need a bit more time to have treatment court evaluation.  Requests rescheduling.  Atty Hendee agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Reset.  
Atty Henney requests bond modification.  Defendant states he can post $400.00.  Atty Hendee opposes any bond modification.
BY THE COURT:  Court will reduce cash bond to 500.00 with the same conditions.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 03:15 pm.
Plea hearing on May 22, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Samuel R Osornio in court with attorney Timothy C Henney.  Defendant Samuel R Osornio in custody.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Henney states his client will waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds defendant has freely, voluntarily and understandingly waived his right to a preliminary hearing.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
State files Information.  Atty Henney received the Information and waives it's reading.  Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Bond continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 28, 2014 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Samuel R Osornio in court with attorney Margaret Waterman.  Defendant Samuel R Osornio in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF27 & 14CM66 (tracking with felony case)
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Waterman waives time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Prelim.  Time limits waived.
14CM66 tracking with.

Atty Hendee requests that the bond cover 14CM66 as well with the same conditions..
Atty Waterman has no objection.
BY THE COURT:  Bond in 14CF27 will cover 14CM66 as well.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Samuel R Osornio in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Defendant Samuel R Osornio in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Henney states that he was appointed by the PD office by phone so he has not received all the paperwork yet on this case.    Atty Henney states that he did receive a copy of the criminal complaint before the hearing today.  Atty Henney requests bond modification.
Atty Hendee did ask for $1,500 cash at the original bond hearing and states that the court set a $1,000 cash bond.  Atty Hendee asks the court to deny the motion to modify the bond.

BY THE COURT:  Court denies the motion to modify the cash bond; bond will remain the same.
STATEMENT ON COMPLIANCE
letter from defendant regarding bond
Bail/Bond Review on March 27, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
Initial appearance on March 31, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

with conditions:
*Defendant is not to leave the State of Wisconsin

Defendant Samuel R Osornio in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Hendee requests a $1,500 cash bond with conditions..  Atty Hendee states that there will be charges on another matter as well.  Atty Hendee states that the defendant has charges in Columbia County and is out on a cash bond for that case.  Atty Gumz responds and states that the defendant's sister is in the courtroom today.  Atty Gumz requests a $500 cash bond.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,000 cash bond with conditions:
*Defendant is not to leave the State of Wisconsin  Initial appearance scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
